title: Best Top Laners Patch 7.24b
body:
I am just looking for some advice as to what Top Laner to get, probably not a tank and requires a bit of skill to use.

Thinking about {{champion:126}}  or {{champion:41}}.

Anyone have other ideas?

replies.body:
imo a safer bet would be {{champion:114}} for fighters, {{champion:14}} for tanks, {{champion:24}} for bruisers, and {{champion:8}}  for mage top.

They're on the up and coming being just below alot of the pick or ban toplaners in winrates, aren't on the nerf radar, have easy to learn - hard to master kits (good amount of skill expression but not overly hard to pull off against decent ranked opponents, as apposed to gangplank, where you may or may not work out how to barrel combo effectively after even a 100 games and god knows how long in practice tool), don't fall off too hard lategame, are somewhat viable in any meta, have good catchup mechanics, have dominant earlygames (except jax) and alot of base damage and chase/dive abilities that allow you to snowball and are very good at taking a lead and running with it to carry a game.

Very good low elo pubstompers whilst still being viable as you climb. Also jayce is getting nerfed and falls in and out of the meta depending on tanks and lethality, and that just doesn't feel reliable enough to invest time to learn him for. Yeah he's the biggest lane bully in high mmr, but when he falls out of meta, he isn't very viable.
Gnar and Illaoi are my two favourites (Whether or not they're good on this patch i have no idea), Camille is also pretty decent, Jayce is strong so if you want 1 of those two, he's your best bet
